sanskrit_verse:
स यदि प्रतिपद्येत यथान्यस्तं यथाकृतम् ।
न तत्र विद्यते किं चिद्यत्परैरभियुज्यते ॥ ८.१८३॥
transliteration:
sa yadi pratipadyeta yathānyastaṁ yathākṛtam |
na tatra vidyate kiṁ cid yatparair abhiyujyate || 8.183||
sph_interpretive_translation: When one accepts fully as another has accepted, in the same manner and form—as there is nothing remaining to be claimed by others.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is realized through complete assumption of consequence
Causation aligns with conscious acceptance of action-result sequence
Capacity-based responsibility arises upon voluntary mirroring of another's completion
Restoration occurs when identification with separate-doership dissolves
Consciousness alignment manifests through dissolution of claim-consciousness
executable_legal_axioms: IF an agent A voluntarily assumes the exact karmic position of agent B THEN all residual claims against B dissolve by default
IF identity-mirroring occurs without residue THEN no third-party adjudication is required
IF acceptance equals prior enactment THEN legal duality ceases
IF capacity for mirroring is demonstrated THEN automatic restoration of dharma-field is executed
IF no distinction remains between claimant and claimed THEN jurisdictional basis vanishes
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that when a party fully embodies the experiential and causal stance of another—without divergence or retention—the court recognizes spontaneous resolution of dispute. No external judgment or enforcement mechanism applies where total identification has occurred. The threshold of responsibility becomes self-terminating.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality resolves through conscious re-enactment devoid of egoic retention. As sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) is mirrored precisely, proportional responsibility collapses into unity. There is no punitive element; only recognition that what was never truly divided cannot remain in conflict.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Facilitate full experiential mirroring until subjective boundaries dissolve
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Enable voluntary absorption of all consequences until none remain unowned
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Realign cognitive-emotive structures to reflect non-dual awareness
Integrity Reintegration Sequence: Confirm cessation of claim-consciousness through ontological audit
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: This Dharma restores unity through perfect reflection. No punishment exists where consciousness awakens to its indivisible nature. Reality adjudicates through awakening alone.
